intro: Ligusticum cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' lovage, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats at high altitudes. Its leaves are compound, with a distinct silvery-white underside, and it produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbel-like clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
